definitions.definition: Moving or directed toward one side .
examples: Giving Mary a sideways glance, he said, [ … ] .
He gave the ball a sideways kick.

definitions.definition: Positioned sideways ( with a side to the front ) .
examples: There was a stack of papers in front of each seat at the table, but each stack was sideways .

definitions.definition: Neither moving upward nor moving downward .
examples: Once we get out of this sideways economy, our figures will more accurately reflect what we're truly capable of.
He was constantly getting sideways with his boss till he got fired.

main_definition: Moving or directed toward one side .
secondary_definitions: ( informal ) Positioned sideways ( with a side to the front ) .
( informal ) Neither moving upward nor moving downward .
( usually with "with" , informal ) In conflict (with); not compatible (with).
